html: Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) is a standard markup language used to create web pages.
css: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML.
js: JavaScript (JS) is a high-level programming language used primarily for client-side web development.
react: React is a JavaScript library used for building user interfaces, focusing on component-based architecture and virtual DOM manipulation.
nextjs: Next.js is a React-based framework used for building server-side rendered and statically generated web applications.
vue: Vue.js is a JavaScript framework used for building user interfaces, focusing on reactivity and declarative rendering.
java: Java is a general-purpose programming language designed to be fast, secure, and platform-independent.
python: Python is a high-level programming language used for general-purpose programming, data science, and web development.
postgresql: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) known for its scalability and robustness.
mongodb: MongoDB is a popular NoSQL database that uses a document-oriented data model and provides scalability, flexibility, and performance.
wordpress: WordPress is a popular content management system (CMS) used for creating websites, blogs, and online stores.
mysql: MySQL is a widely-used, open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) known for its speed and reliability.
typo3: TYPO3 is a powerful, open-source content management system (CMS) designed for enterprise-level websites and applications.
go: Go, also known as Golang, is a programming language known for its simplicity, concurrency support, and efficient memory management.
git: Git is a distributed version control system used for tracking changes in source code during software development.
docker: Docker is a platform used for building, shipping, and running applications in containers, providing a lightweight and portable environment.
tailwind: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides pre-defined classes for rapidly building custom UI designs.
spring: Spring Boot is a popular framework for building enterprise-level Java applications, providing an opinionated approach to configuration and deployment.
atlassian: Atlassian is a software company that provides a suite of tools for software development, collaboration, and project management.
adobe: Adobe Suite is a collection of design software used for creating visual and interactive media, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.
bash: Bash is a shell language used for executing commands in Unix and Unix-like operating systems.
c: C is a low-level programming language used for system-level programming, embedded systems, and high-performance computing.
sql: SQL, or Structured Query Language, is a programming language used for managing and querying relational databases.
rabbitmq: RabbitMQ is a popular message broker used for exchanging data between distributed systems, providing reliability and scalability.
arduino: Arduino is an open-source platform for developing interactive electronic prototypes and IoT applications.
c++: C++ is an object-oriented programming language that builds on top of C and is commonly used for applications like games, desktop software, and system programming.
title: What I can do.
description: This overview shows my proficiency level with a certain skill or tool. Select an icon to learn more about a certain programming language or tool.
